TITLE: With just 8% of new vehicles costing under $30,000, 'it’s the least affordable car market in modern history,' expert says
SUMMARY: As consumer tastes change, carmakers are upgrading their lineups and scaling back on less-expensive cars.

TITLE: Biden says he's working on a new path to student loan forgiveness after Supreme Court decision
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden suggested on Friday that he was looking for another avenue to deliver student debt relief after the Supreme Court rejected his forgiveness plan.

TITLE: Supreme Court strikes down Biden's student loan forgiveness plan
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court on Friday struck down President Biden's student loan forgiveness plan, denying millions of Americans up to $20,000 of debt relief.

TITLE: While investors can't expect a deal like former baseball star Bobby Bonilla, they can use an annuity to create a stream of income in retirement
SUMMARY: Annuities are a form of pension or stream of income payments over time. This piece explains the concept of annuities in honor of Bobby Bonilla Day.

TITLE: Supreme Court's student loan decision will have 'detrimental impact' on borrowers, financial advisor says
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court's student loan decision may have a 'detrimental impact' on borrowers, financial advisor says. Here's how to prepare before payments resume.

TITLE: What Supreme Court ruling against Biden's student loan forgiveness plan could mean for the U.S. economy
SUMMARY: The end of student debt forgiveness plans will have a small effect on the economy, say experts, helping to fight inflation although consumer spending may drop.

TITLE: Supreme Court block of Biden’s student loan forgiveness could cause college enrollment to fall, experts say
SUMMARY: Between the high cost of college and debt burden, more students may opt out altogether, some experts say.

TITLE: Canceled, delayed flights are likely over July 4 holiday weekend. What to know about your rights
SUMMARY: Travelers faced with a flight disruption over the Independence Day holiday weekend may be entitled to a refund, or complimentary rebooking, hotel stay or meal.

TITLE: This safety net for the elderly and disabled comes with strict rules on savings. That may change
SUMMARY: Supplemental Security Income benefits provide a safety net for low-income elderly and disabled individuals. But the program also comes with saving restrictions.

TITLE: What the Supreme Court's decision on affirmative action at colleges means for future applicants
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court's decision on affirmative action could affect how best to present yourself on a college application, experts say.

TITLE: 4 ways to save on cooling costs as a dangerous heat wave grips millions of Americans
SUMMARY: Here are four ways to save on cooling costs as a dangerous heat wave threatens millions of Americans.

TITLE: Supreme Court decision on student loan forgiveness expected Friday
SUMMARY: The justices are highly likely to issue their decision on student loan forgiveness within 24 hours, and right before they break for summer recess.

TITLE: 3 reasons it can be smarter to rent, even if you can afford to buy
SUMMARY: Flexibility, the "nuisance" factor and the hidden costs of homeownership may mean renting is the better choice for some people.

TITLE: Social Security phone service disruptions led to dropped calls, longer wait times, report finds
SUMMARY: Social Security prioritized phone services after the onset of Covid-19. But outdated technology and other glitches led to disruptions, a report found.

TITLE: Here's what a new Supreme Court case could mean for federal wealth tax proposals
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court will soon hear a case that could have broad effects on the U.S. tax code, including future wealth tax proposals.

TITLE: Your 401(k) plan may be worsening climate change, expert says
SUMMARY: As worried about climate change you might be, it can be tricky, if not impossible, for you to consider the environment in your 401(k) plan. Here's why.

TITLE: Here are moves parents can make to help adult child become financially independent, advisor says
SUMMARY: These days, it can take years before young adults are able to pay their own way. However, some money moves may speed up the process.

TITLE: Decision of when to retire has little to do with how much you've saved for retirement, report finds
SUMMARY: U.S. households over age 55 control 74% of investable assets, but their retirement status has little to do with their asset levels, according to a new report.

TITLE: Some advisors are flocking to alternative investments, survey finds. What investors need to know
SUMMARY: Some advisors are turning to alternative investments, according to a new survey from the Financial Planning Association. Here's what investors need to know.

TITLE: Don't budget, says financial psychologist. Here's why he recommends a 'spending plan' instead
SUMMARY: Budgeting helps address areas you need to control but can come across as restrictive. Spending plans offer more freedom.

TITLE: Term life insurance is often best, financial advisors say — but most people buy another kind
SUMMARY: There are two broad categories of life insurance: term and permanent. Most people buy the latter, data shows, which doesn't jibe with advisors' suggestion.

TITLE: 'Enormously costly' business loan fraud drove inflation in home prices in certain markets, research suggests
SUMMARY: Covid-era PPP loan fraud may have contributed to home price inflation in certain U.S. markets, research suggests.

TITLE: Publishers Clearing House to refund customers $18.5 million in FTC settlement for 'deceptive' practices
SUMMARY: Publishers Clearing House used so-called dark patterns to deceive consumers, the Federal Trade Commission said.

TITLE: Americans think they will need nearly $1.3 million to retire comfortably, study says. How to calculate your own 'magic number'
SUMMARY: When it comes to retirement, many Americans have a big-dollar figure in mind for how much they will need. However, they have much less set aside on average.

TITLE: Amid falling inflation, recent signs show fewer Americans are living paycheck to paycheck
SUMMARY: Recent signs show some relief for households, who have leaned heavily on their paychecks as prices spiked over the last year.

TITLE: How many credit cards should you have? The answer isn’t zero, say experts
SUMMARY: Having one card and using it responsibly can help build your credit score. But there may be benefits to having two or three, experts said.

TITLE: How New York City's sky-high cost of living stacks up to London
SUMMARY: New York and London are incredibly similar when it comes to lifestyle and cost of living, but London is slightly more affordable across the board.

TITLE: Here's how workers use side gigs to make ends meet while unemployed
SUMMARY: Workers who pick up side gigs as a second income or to tide over a job loss were more likely to receive unemployment insurance in 2016, study finds.

TITLE: Why it's important to spend on joy, according to a financial advisor
SUMMARY: It's important for people to have a financial plan for the future and to work toward meeting goals. But it's also crucial to enjoy the present, advisor says.

TITLE: Here's how much you can make and still pay 0% capital gains taxes for 2023
SUMMARY: Inflation boosted the capital gains tax brackets for 2023. Here's how much you can make to pay 0% capital gains on investments.
